ca.mcgill.ecse211.captureflag

Class UltrasonicLocalization

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.captureflag.UltrasonicLocalization

  • public class UltrasonicLocalization
extends java.lang.Object
    The UltrasonicLocalization class is used to orient the robot to 0 degrees. It is used only in the beginning of the competition, when the robot is still in the corner.

      • UltrasonicLocalization

        public UltrasonicLocalization(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                              EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                              Odometer odometer)
        The constructor for the UltrasonicLocalization class
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - An instance of the EV3LargeRegulatedMotor that controls the left motor.
        rightMotor - An instance of the EV3LargeRegulatedMotor that controls the right motor.
        odometer - An instance of the Odometer class.

    • Method Detail

      • localize

        protected void localize()
        The falling and rising edges are detected in this method. The rising edge is when the sensor goes from facing the wall to away from the wall and the falling edge is from away from the wall to towards the wall. If no falling edge is detected and the distance drops below the constant then a falling edge is said to have been detected. Then if a falling edge is detected and the distance rises above our horizontal constant, a rising edge is said to be detected. The angle return by the odometer is then saved. Then, the method uses both angles to determine by how much the robot should turn to make it face north (0 degrees)

      • readUSDistance

        public int readUSDistance()

      • processUSData

        public void processUSData(int distance)
        Filter any extraneous distances returned by the sensor
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance recorded by the US sensor

      • isLocalizing

        protected boolean isLocalizing()
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the robot is in ultrasonic localization

      • risingEdge

        private void risingEdge()
        Calculates a correction angle based on a rising edge formula. This method of localization is preferred if the robot is facing a wall.

      • fallingEdge

        private void fallingEdge()
        Calculates a correction angle based on a falling edge formula. This method of localization is preferred if the robot is facing away from a wall.
